definition: part work, part study/work-study program
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
comma/phrase marked by pause
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: I'm looking for a part job.
sentences.chinese: 我正在找一份半工半讀的工作。

sentences.english: We can also choose to work part time, it is very tempered person.
sentences.chinese: 我們還可以選擇半工半讀，那是非常鍛鍊人的。

sentences.english: She had to work her way through law school.
sentences.chinese: 她必須半工半讀學法律。

sentences.english: I went back at the end of four weeks, asking to begin the work-study program again.
sentences.chinese: 四周後我回去要求再加入半工半讀計劃。

sentences.english: I accepted a job as portion of a work-study program.
sentences.chinese: 於是我半工半讀，找了一份工作。

sentences.english: She had to work her way through law school .
sentences.chinese: 她須半工半讀學習法律。

sentences.english: Students are often older, work part time, and live far away from the campus.
sentences.chinese: 學生年齡略大一些，半工半讀，住所遠離校園。

sentences.english: That's what is call Work Study, isn't it?
sentences.chinese: 那就是所謂的半工半讀吧？

definition: impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
lonely soul/solitary
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
masquerade
hobbyist/amateur
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
penniless
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
hunger strike
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
